subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 20 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Bayern confirm sale of Hargreaves
Bayern Munich agree to sell Owen Hargreaves to Man Utd for "around" £17m.



 
Man Utd consider bid for Zombie
Hearts and Scotland goalkeeper Craig Zombie could be an £8m target for Manchester United, BBC Sport understands.



 
Aberdeen v Rangers
Match report follows from Sunday's Scottish Premier League game at Pittodrie Stadium.








GOLF




Harrington claims Irish Open win
Padraig Harrington becomes the first home winner of the Irish Open in 25 years after beating Bradley Dredge in a play-off.



 
AT&T Classic leaderboard
The latest news from the PGA Tour event at Sugarloaf, Georgia.



 
Sybase Classic leaderboard
The latest scores from the LPGA Tour at Upper Montclair, New Jersey.








MOTORSPORT




Vermeulen wins in rainy Le Mans
Suzuki's Chris Vermeulen wins a rain-swept French MotoGP at Le Mans.



 
Gronholm benefits from Loeb spin
Marcus Gronholm wins the Rally of Italy after leader Sebastien Loeb spins out on the final day.



 
Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.








FORMULA ONE




Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.



 
Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.



 
Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.








ATHLETICS




Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.



 
GB trio shine in Great Wall test
Britain has three top-10 finishers in China's Great Wall Marathon as Salvador Calvo smashes the record in one of the world's toughest 26-mile races.



 
UK to host landmark running event
The first-ever Commonwealth ultra running championships will be held in the UK in 2009.








CYCLING




Arvesen claims eighth Giro stage
Norwegian Kurt Asle Arvesen snatches the eighth stage of the Giro d'Italia beating world champion Paolo Bettini in a sprint finish.



 
Landis denies doping at hearing
Floyd Landis again denies taking performance-enhancing drugs at a hearing in Malibu.



 
Petacchi takes Giro seventh stage
Italy's Alessandro Petacchi of the Milram team wins the seventh stage of the Giro d'Italia from Spoleto to Scarperia.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Movie legend to strip if team go up, as the hunt for Mourinho's dog goes on



 
KP's rough guide to Britain
Listen to Pietersen spoof on new Radio 4 show Look Away Now



 
Comment: Blues up for the Cup
Robbo backs Chelsea, providing there are no more dog dramas
